title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

sdumitriu - (10:21): vmassol: Try http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Sandbox/lipsum?editor=wiki  
GillesSerasset joined #xwiki at 10:41  
sdumitriu - (10:45): vmassol: Is that what you wanted?  
vmassol - (10:46): sdumitriu: http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Sandbox/lipsum?editor=wiki&force=1 is good but it's the same as before. I like it though :)  
vmassol - (10:46): can you tell me what's changed?  
sdumitriu - (10:46): The editor should resize to fill the available screen height  
sdumitriu - (10:46): + it should be resizable  
sdumitriu - (10:46): I can't find the jira reference  
vmassol - (10:47): ah that's great  
vmassol - (10:47): :)  
sdumitriu - (10:47): Does it do that?  
vmassol - (10:47): yes  
vmassol - (10:47): it's very cool  
vmassol - (10:47): thanks a lot for that  
sdumitriu - (10:48): Is the height good?  
sdumitriu - (10:48): It should fill the height, leaving only the footer out (version, copyright)  
sdumitriu - (10:51): vmassol: Can you help me find the Jira issue?  
sdumitriu - (10:52): I can only find XWIKI-1460, but I remember there was another one  
sdumitriu - (10:53): Found, XWIKI-1813  
tmortagne left at 11:00 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (11:08): sdumitriu: sorry was otp

GillesSerasset - (15:03): tmortagne: I added a "Group" functionality to Meeting Manager application, it allows inviting/removing a full group from the meeting participants  
GillesSerasset - (15:03): tmortagne: It's quite rough in it's current interface, but I con give you an access to our current install for you to test  
GillesSerasset - (15:04): tmortagne: after that, we may see how I can contibute to the application  
tmortagne - (15:08): GillesSerasset: sorry i don't have time right now to look at it (preparing 2.2 release) but you should ask jvelo if you have questions about Meeting Manager since he is the author of the application i think  
GillesSerasset - (15:08): sorry, I thought you were the author  
GillesSerasset - (15:09): jvelo: I added a "Group" functionality to Meeting Manager application, it allows inviting/removing a full group from the meeting participants  
jvelo - (15:09): Hi GillesSerasset  
GillesSerasset - (15:09): jvelo:It's quite rough in it's current interface, but I con give you an access to our current install for you to test  
jvelo - (15:10): sounds good  
jvelo - (15:10): can you repackage a XAR using the Import/Export tool ?  
jvelo - (15:10): so that I can test it locally  
bblfish - (15:10): hello  
GillesSerasset - (15:10): ok, I'll do it  
jvelo - (15:10): cool  
jvelo - (15:10): you can attach it to JIRA  
bblfish - (15:11): I am wondering how one can do the following in the new component framework  
bblfish - (15:11): type of behavior does  not work  
bblfish - (15:11): [11:42pm] bblfish: 2    BaseClass bclass = doc.getxWikiClass();  
bblfish - (15:11): [11:42pm] bblfish:         bclass.setName("XWiki.CalendarEvent");  
bblfish - (15:11): [11:42pm] bblfish:         needsUpdate |= bclass.addTextField("user", "User", 30);  
jvelo - (15:11): the project is http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XCONTRIB  
jvelo - (15:11): their is a component for the meeting manager  
jvelo - (15:11): then don't hesitate to ping me about  
GillesSerasset - (15:11): I know, I filed the feature request  
jvelo - (15:12): (in case I miss the notification)  
jvelo - (15:12): ok  
jvelo - (15:12): great then  
bblfish - (15:13): the above code is taken from the old plugin architecture  
bblfish - (15:13): but I was told to use the component  
bblfish - (15:14): I can use the DocumentAccessBridge  
bblfish - (15:14): but I am not sure how to get the class from that  
plunden1 left #xwiki at 15:19  
jvdrean1 joined #xwiki at 15:22  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 18:15  
Lord\_Devi - (18:17): Oh!! One more quick question... Those panels you helped me with.. When I was poking around there on the admin page, I saw no button to create new panels... Do I have to create new ones from the shell and not the webpage or something?  
vmassol1 - (18:17): yes we need to address this, for now you have to go to the Panels.WebHome page  
vmassol1 - (18:18): ctrl+G for ex  
vmassol1 - (18:18): or in the URL directly  
vmassol1 - (18:18): or the All Docs page  
vmassol1 - (18:18): (all docs = index page)  
Lord\_Devi - (18:19): Oh ok I see I see  
vmassol1 - (18:19): tmortagne and others: what are we missing for the final 2.2 release?  
Lord\_Devi - (18:19): Yeah that meta+g was ingeniously handy btw =)  
vmassol1 - (18:19): any open issues?  
tmortagne - (18:20): fixed http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4898 but waiting for asiri to validate  
vmassol1 - (18:20): is that the only blocker?  
tmortagne - (18:20): all other issues can move i think  
tmortagne - (18:20): in core  
tmortagne - (18:20): looking at xe  
vmassol1 - (18:21): do we need more testing?  
tmortagne - (18:21): always :)  
vmassol1 - (18:21): we haven't heard any pb on myxwiki.org I think but then we almost  never hear from users there  
tmortagne - (18:21): yes  
tmortagne - (18:22): don't see anything blocker in xe issues  
tmortagne - (18:23): waiting for hudson to rebuild tests  
mflorea left at 18:25 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne left at 18:36 (Quit: Leaving.  
Lord\_Devi - (18:43): Would it be erroneous of me to guess that most of the demonstration scripting I am seeing in the default xwiki install is velocity?  
vmassol1 - (18:43): no  
vmassol1 - (18:43): it wouldn't be erroneous  
vmassol1 - (18:44): it's 100% velocity  
Lord\_Devi - (18:44): Cool cool  
Lord\_Devi - (18:44): Velocity actually looks really simple too  
vmassol1 - (18:44): it is  
vmassol1 - (18:44): even guillaume lerouge picked it up… ah too bad he isn't here right now ;)  
Lord\_Devi - (18:45): hehe..  
Lord\_Devi - (18:45): Oh yeah? =) I've seen his name on a whole bunch of the wiki articles i've been goin through...  
vmassol1 - (18:46): he's a marketing guy with no IT background...  
vmassol1 - (18:46): but he's now picked up xwiki quite quickly  
vmassol1 - (18:46): and he can now write wiki applications in wiki pages  
vmassol1 - (18:46): he's written a few on http://code.xwiki.org  
vmassol1 - (18:46): that's a cool testimonial that it's not too hard….  
vmassol1 - (18:46): or that he's a genius  
vmassol1 - (18:47): :)  
Lord\_Devi - (18:47): Oh very cool. bodes well for me then!! =)  
Lord\_Devi - (18:47): I am absolutely loving xwiki so far, but it's really making me want to learn that Velocity now :P  
vmassol1 - (18:47): hehe  
vmassol1 - (18:47): the power of xwiki is huge but indeed it needs a bit of knowledge to harvest the full power  
Lord\_Devi - (18:48): Hey quick question vm.. My little panel I'm creating on my own here... It has that "Jump to any page in the wiki (meta+g) reminder at the footer.. is there a way to supress that? Looking at the other examples I have I don't even know why it's there... \*smirks\*  
vmassol1 - (18:48): hmm that should come from teh quick links panel content  
sdumitriu - (18:48): It's generated by Javascript  
sdumitriu - (18:48): Not in the panel  
vmassol1 - (18:49): ah didn't know that  
Lord\_Devi - (18:49): Yeah that's what I thought, but this isn't an edited quick links panel. It's created fresh from Panels.WebHome  
vmassol1 - (18:49): that's strange  
vmassol1 - (18:49): sdumitriu: do you know why?  
vmassol1 - (18:49): why does it need js?  
Lord\_Devi - (18:49): Maybe it has to do with the strange way I got rid of quick links.. I tried to revert to a previous version but it wasn't there - so i ended up deleting it entirely while it still added as a panel on the left frame.  
Lord\_Devi - (18:50): \*shrugs\*  
Lord\_Devi - (18:52): Yeah weird. It must have been. I removed it. Saved layout. Added it again, and it was gone. It had to have something to do with my screwy removal of Quick Links =)  
vmassol1 - (18:52): Lord\_Devi: sdumitriu should know better  
sdumitriu - (18:53): vmassol1: It needs JS because without JS it will be misleading  
sdumitriu - (18:54): Pressing Ctrl+G wouldn't do anything  
sdumitriu - (18:54): So it would be a piece of text advertising missing functionality  
vmassol1 - (18:55): sdumitriu: but the js is alwyas there  
vmassol1 - (18:55): it's not optional  
vmassol1 - (18:55): in any case it brings the issue at hand  
vmassol1 - (18:55): which IMO is worse  
sdumitriu - (18:55): The JS is optional  
sdumitriu - (18:55): It always is  
sdumitriu - (18:55): There's a little thing called NoScript  
vmassol1 - (18:56): you mean if you disable it from the browser?  
vmassol1 - (18:56): then why we don't we verify if js is active and only show the text if it is?  
Lord\_Devi - (18:56): yay noscript...  
Lord\_Devi - (18:57): hehe, curious question. vmass, sdum, which distro do you two prefer?  
vmassol1 - (18:58): OSX 10.6.2  
vmassol1 - (18:58): got to go  
sdumitriu - (18:58): Gentoo  
vmassol1 left at 18:58 (Quit: Leaving.  
Lord\_Devi - (18:58): Thanks for the help Vmass!  
Lord\_Devi - (18:58): Ah yeah ok. Just curious!  
Lord\_Devi - (18:59): i used gentoo for years and years.. but not for some time now.  
sdumitriu - (18:59): Gentoo users without coding skills?  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 19:00  
Lord\_Devi - (19:00): Hehe, well I never do much programming, but I do plenty of scripting ;)  
Lord\_Devi - (19:00): Lots of need for that!  
Lord\_Devi - (19:01): Particularly lax are any sort of web development skills. I still miss gopher  
sdumitriu - (19:02): Velocity is a kind of scripting  
Lord\_Devi - (19:05): Yeah it all looks pretty familiar for the most part  
Lord\_Devi - (19:06): Definately going to be spending some time learning it
